question: What is true regarding ‘Fence’?
options: ['a) Its a method to confine users to one side of a boundary', 'b) It can protect Operating system from one user', 'c) It cannot protect users from each other', 'd) All of the mentioned']

option2: b) It can protect Operating system from one user
option3: c) It cannot protect users from each other

option1: a) It is implemented via hardware register

question: How can fence and relocation be used together?
options: ['a) To each program address, the contents of fence register are added', 'b) To contents of fence register is subtracted from actual address of program', 'c) To each program address, the contents of fence register are not added', 'd) None of the mentioned']
option1: a) To each program address, the contents of fence register are added
option2: b) To contents of fence register is subtracted from actual address of program
option3: c) To each program address, the contents of fence register are not added
explanation: This both relocates the address and guarantees that no one can access a location lower than a fence address.
